sent_vocabs: recalcitrant - having an obstinately uncooperative attitude
sycophant - a person who acts obsequiously toward someone to gain advantage
ubiquitous - present, appearing, or found everywhere
xerophilous - adapted to a dry environment
zeitgeist - the defining spirit or mood of a particular period of history
didactic - intended to teach, particularly in having moral instruction as an ulterior motive
feckless - lacking initiative or strength of character; irresponsible
occlude - stop, close up, or obstruct
parsimonious - unwilling to spend money or resources
verdant - green with grass or other rich vegetation
idiosyncrasy - a distinctive or peculiar feature or characteristic
hapless - unfortunate; unlucky
wanton - deliberate and unprovoked; gratuitous
reticent - not revealing one's thoughts or feelings readily
perspicacious - having keen mental perception and understanding
torpid - mentally or physically inactive; lethargic
inimical - tending to obstruct or harm
perfunctory - carried out with minimal effort
serendipity - the occurrence of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way
enigmatic - difficult to interpret or understand; mysterious
obfuscate - to deliberately make something unclear or difficult to understand
quixotic - exceedingly idealistic; unrealistic and impractical
juxtaposition - the fact of two things being placed close together with contrasting effect
taciturn - reserved or uncommunicative in speech; saying little
yoke - a wooden crosspiece fastened over the necks of two animals and attached to a plow or cart
recondite - difficult to understand or obscure; abstruse
efficacious - effective as a means, remedy, or action
sagacious - having or showing keen mental discernment and good judgment
sesquipedalian - characterized by long words; long-winded
obsequious - obedient or attentive to an excessive degree
insidious - proceeding in a gradual, subtle way, but with harmful effects
zenith - the time at which something is most powerful or successful
vacillate - waver between different opinions or actions; be indecisive
jettison - throw or drop from an aircraft or ship
sent_phrases: Put your nose to the grindstone
Hit the nail on the head
Get along like a house on fire
Up a creek without a paddle
Light at the end of the tunnel
Dot your i's and cross your t's
The ball is in your court
Between a rock and a hard place
Cross that bridge when you come to it
Let the cat out of the bag
Take the bull by the horns
